name: Crown Paradise Club Cancun

reviews.text: In simple words: filthy, bad food, terrible service, management is not professional, noisy, rooms are in bad shape. Hotel needs to be renovated. Definitely not even close to a five star hotel...
reviews.title: Dirty and Low

reviews.text: Someone recommended this hotel to me and i would definitely recommend it to others. Crown Paradise Club was an amazing stay. The whole family had a great time. There were plenty of activities for both adults and children. The beach was great, the pools were great, and overall the whole vacation was great.
reviews.title: Great Stay at The Crown Paradise

reviews.text: We booked our family vacation soley from the pictures and amenities we saw on the internet. Let's just say it was nothing like the site pictures. First, it took complaining on 3 different occasions before we got a room that smelled decent. The rooms smell awful! We were told we would have bottled water given at the hotel since the water is not suitable to drink. I never once saw a bottle of water. We had to go to walmart just to keep drinking water in the room.
reviews.title: Nothing like we expected! Disappointed

reviews.text: Second, the food is awful! We paid for all-inclusive but only ate at the resort on few occasions. What a waste! The cafeteria was terrible and a complete joke!
reviews.title: great stay for families

likes.liked: — staff and access to surrounding amenities.

reviews.text: The only good thing I can say is my 3 year old loved the water slide. It was a little old but we spent a good portion of the day watching him go down the slides. He had fun and that is all that is important, right? I just would not recommend and definitely would not go back
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay

likes.disliked: — The Way Somepeople Reserved Sunbeds Long Before They Used Then

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here the past 4 days (Feb 5-9) with my wife - both of us are in our late 20s. Read many reviews prior to booking and had some reservations thast I will cover:
reviews.title: Couples Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: *Lots of kids - we thought the kids were fine, they mostly were at the pools and in the kid areas in the southern portion of the resort.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT HOTEL

reviews.text: *Loud rooms - we had a room that faced to the north, very quiet, slept great
reviews.title: Really good resort

reviews.text: *Bad view to the north - sure you are looking at a place that was ruined by a hurricane but you still have a great view of the beach. Who goes to cancun for the view from their hotel room???
reviews.title: Won't return.

reviews.text: *Weak drinks - were they watered down? They probably were but that means just drink more. The bartenders are very friendly and will make you whatever type of drink you can think of. You can always order shots if all else fails.
reviews.title: Great place for families - out off season
Loved Crown Paradise
reviews.text: We thought the hotel and activities were pretty good. We traveled with our 14 and 16 year old sons, plus family members between 39-45. All had a good time. From what I hear our hotel had more of variety than most. We had 5 restaruants for the evening. The Japanese place was open 12-5pm. The food court was open until 9 and then you could go to another hamburger stand for food. The only bad thing was the food court closed from 11-1230 or something like that and if you stayed up late and wanted to get a late breakfast early lunch, you had to wait or just go get a hamburger or sandwich. But other than that the food was pretty good. Some was too exotic for our taste, but we always found something we liked. As far as tours go, I highly recommend the Xel-ha snorkling tour. Don't combine it with another tour, you won't have enough time to enjoy yourself. you would definitely want all day. Buy the all inclusive package also. If you're there all day, you will want it. I heard the jungle cruise was a good one, but we had to cancel because they scheduled the wrong day. We took the Captain Hook Pirate Cruise, that was pretty good - get there early tho, so you can get a better seat. We would definitely go back to Crown Paradise and are recommending it to all our friends.

This resort was nice for the kids but had some major problems with it. Some of the major problems that we noticed was that they did not have bottled water. We had mildew and 2 inch cockroaches in our room. The toilets kept overflowing on us. When it rained there were huge puddles of water everywhere and people kept on falling because everything was slippery. In an effort to control the puddles they would put 1 towel in the doorway to wipe your feet, which didnt help a whole lot.
reviews.title: The hotel smelled and seriously needed renovation.

reviews.text: The staff was rude and provided misinformation on a constant basis. The restaurants that we went to refused to seat our party of 14 together. When we told them how many were in our party they acted like we were asking the impossible. We upgraded one of our rooms to a family suite and had asked the front desk if we could trade in two regular rooms for one family suite with no additional cost. They said they couldnt do the upgrade that way. They charged us $30 more per night for the family suite and we kept one of the other rooms. But because we rarely ever stayed in the room, the hotel decided that they would rent it out anyway without us finding out. Of course someone walked into our room, which was not the cleaning staff while we were sleeping.
reviews.title: Great for kids and adults

reviews.text: On a better note, the kids club was very nice and all the kids enjoyed it, including the baby club. The bar staff was very friendly, and I personally think, overworked. The food at the restaurants was tasty except for the buffet which I found the staff to be unhelpful and the food was not very tasty.
reviews.title: CPC Awesome vacation with kids!!!

reviews.text: My husband, myself and our 9yr old son stayed at CPC june 4th - 11th. We had a fantastic time. Things could not have gone smoother from the airport to catching up with apple vacation for the ride to the hotel to checking in. We arrived at the hotel at 2:30 pm and recieved a room right away. We were in the old tower on the third floor. We were just about above the bar in the lobby but it was not a problem when we went to sleep. The beds are firm but not uncomfortable by any means. It is just a regular bed without a pillow top. We have a very lush bed at home and we never woke up stiff or sore on these beds. The kids club is fantastic after a few days there our son wanted to have lunch, dinner and go to the shows with them. Emily is fantastic!!!!!!!!!!, as all the staff members there. The last night our son met a friend and we allowed him to hang out at the arcade and sports club with his friend on his own. I felt very safe with him doing this. He kept checking in with us when he would move to a different location but I felt the hotel was very secure for him to do this. The slides at the teens club are great. The staff at the main pool was fantastic. One morning it was raining pretty hard and they brought the entertainment to the lobby till the strom blew over. Rain or shine they are always there to keep you entertained. They even have things going on for the kids besides the kids club. The food there is very good. Always found something to eat. My son ate enough pasta to last a year. I've never seen him eat so much. The only down fall is the floors everywhere especially near the pools are very slick!!!!!!!!!!!!! My husband flew up in the air and head first into the pool one day. Luckily he missed the stools in the pool. You have to be very careful walking around the pools. All in all our trip was fantastic. We would certainly go back. I have no ideal where all the bad reviews came from. Maybe people are just expecting to much. Please, please tip everyone they work 16hr days for not much pay. We even tipped the girls that cleaned the bathrooms everyday. Some of these people do not get noticed for the hard work they do to make life comfortable for you while your visiting.
reviews.title: Great for kids! Would probably return...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed from 1/6 to1/10. Looked nice for families. Not for adults. They
reviews.title: Not for Adults

reviews.text: advertise on the website the Coco Dance Club for Adults only. It looked very nice. The only problem is that it is CLOSED FOR REPAIRS. It has been for months and they don't know when it will reopen yet they don't say that on the site. Food was good. We found no complaint with any of the resturants. Staff was Great. We had a lot of fun in the pool. They work very hard so you have a good time. The Shows were very good. The best being the Las Vegas Show and Casino Night. We stayed in a Crown Club Room with a hot tub in the room. It was great but the room was a bit small. They have Bath Robes and Slippers which were very thin but still a nice touch. On the day before we were to leave we returned to the room at 3pm. We planned a romantic evening for our last night but found that the robes were missing. We called the desk and they said that they remove them on the last day. We were SHOCKED. I hope they don't think that anyone would STEAL that thin, skimpy robe. They should come up with a better system rather than calling your guests in your most expensive rooms CROOKS. For a family with kids it looks like a good deal. For couples-----Look elsewhere
reviews.title: Great Place For Familes

likes.disliked: — The fact I was only there for a week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Crown Club Paradise. We have two boys aged 1.5 and 3.5 and were looking for a resort that catered to their needs primarily.
reviews.title: The service was great!

reviews.text: The Crown Club has it all. The Kids club is for ages +4 but my oldest son enjoyed the pirate ship and the games they have there. The baby club is amazing. The two staff there were fantastic. My oldest son actually asked to go there and my little guy loved it. It is a secure room with lots of activities, movies, a bouncy castle etc. We would take the boys there for max. 2 hours and my wife and I had a few drinks at the pool and got to relax. On two nights we took the kids to the buffet early and then dropped them in at the baby club. We had a nice dinner and picked them up for bed time.
reviews.title: Great family vacation

likes.liked: — Lots of swimming pools and drink service on the beach
likes.disliked: — Buffet restaurant and no fridge in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After dinner we took them to the sports bar where next door they had kids movies with nice leather chairs for them to sit on. We could sit close by and have a drink while they were entertained.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at CPC 2/5/12 to2/11/12 in a Crown Club Room. There was 7 couples in our group (all seniors). The place was good as usual. We have been comming for about 5 years. Usually 3 or 4 couples. It seems to grow every year. The rooms were good. I requested a room on the 8th floor ut was giving one on the 6th floor, Very far from the elevator. That was my only complaint. The place was very clean. The pools and beach was great. We ate in a different resturant every night. They had no trouble seating 14 of us. The service was great. The CPC Crown Club was the best. You must be in a Crown Club Room to get in. Well worth the extra price. We watched the Super Bowl there on a large screen TV and was waited on by the very friendly staff. I can,t remember the bartenders name that night but he was great. In the mornings we had, Moises. He is a credit to your hotel. He helped me on the computer and he really knew what he was doing. Overall the entire staff was great. (except the front desk). The pool staff are the hardest workers I ever saw. Great job Mike and David. Will be back next year, god willing.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.text: First, service is FANTASTIC by the service staff. For example, my preg wife came down the elevator and she must be eyeing the staff wheeling by with bottled water. As if by telepathy, the staff offered her to take as many bottled waters as she wanted! (BTW, it is all-inclusive but you have to ask for bottled water normally through room service)
reviews.title: Could be better

reviews.text: On the other hand, they made it difficult to get my refund. I had to get Travelocity on the phone while I was in Mexico and fortunately, they agreeably refunded my money for the unused days, so I'm fairly happy.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, onward to my review then (after all, why did I switch hotel).
reviews.title: Awesome service!

reviews.text: First, I had an AWFUL room. It was in Bldg 2 (the older wing, further away from the lobby). Somehow they did not have the basics such as a clock radio or a in-room safe. Also, they gave us a bag of sheets so I had to make my own bed! What kind of service is that? The room had 2 beds..a King-size bed and a secondary bed. It also had a full-fridge, sink, microwave, and cooking pans. There were NO closets (other than the tall amoire for holding the bulky TV). Also when we slept, there is this annoying strobing light that I guess is from the smoke detector or fire alarm...NOT cool.
reviews.title: Nice Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from Cancun, CPC. We stayed from 1/30/11 to 2/4/11. Everything was great. This is the 3rd time we been there. We stayed in a Crown Club Room (2701) and everything was outstanding. We went with 3 other couples. The staff treats you like a king. The food was GREAT. We ate in the French, Italian, Waynes Boots,( a lot of fun) and the buffet. We also did the snack bar by the pool and the Japanese resturant. The beach was really great. It was a lot wider than it was 2 years ago. We were on the beach every day. The Cabanna's were very nice. We cannot wait to come back next year. For the price you pay it cannot be beat. Thank you CPC.
reviews.title: We LOVE Crown Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we visited, the resort was booked full, there are not enough chairs on beach or poolside to accomadate guests, many chairs on beach are broken, you have to get up by 6:30 am to get a chair poolside, people are out there in the dark reserving chairs, if you leave your chair on beach to go for swim people will throw your stuff in the sand and steal your chair, hotel should provide enough chairs for all guests, shouldn't have to fight for one.
reviews.title: Dissappointed, would not return to crown paradise

reviews.text: Food was a hassle, a la cartes were good but difficult to get in, either all booked or no answer when you go to reserve and can only reseve 24 hours in advance. Buffet was horrible, always running out of everything, brown lettuce every day for 2 weeks, same things in buffet every day. Shushi was good but have to wait an hour for food then can only order two items, this is not all inclusive!!!! Rooms just o.k needed many repairs and very dated, rock hard beds, but rooms were clean.
reviews.title: This was our first all inclusive and WE LOVED IT!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: I too read all the reviews and maybe the people who have written the good ones have visited when the hotel is not busy and they had a better experience, as for me I would not go back to crown club paradise. This resort would be a 3 star at best.
reviews.title: fantastic for kids!!!
The reviews dont do this place justice. A great vacation spot for the whole family..
reviews.text: After reading all of the negative comments, we were unsure of this resort. DO NOT BELIEVE ANY OF IT! I think that all of these negative comments come from people who are not happy with anything. Our room (with bunk beds) was perfect. It was clean and our beds were made everyday AND we also saw the maids scrubbing the tub and bathroom EVERYDAY! The beds were great - yes they were firm, but what's wrong with a firm bed - that is what we are supposed to be sleeping on. We did not even ask for a topper. We phoned everyday for room service, asking for 6 waters - they were delivered quickly. The food was AMAZING - if you find something you don't like - don't have it again - there are SO MANY things to choose from. It was delicious. We phoned every morning at 8:00 to book for the NEXT day at an a la carte restaurant. If you don't do this, you may not get in. Many people expected to just walk in or reserve an hour before the meal. Call the day before. You can only call one day in advance. The only restaurant that we didn't go twice to was the Mexican one - it just wasn't our favourite. The beach was beautiful. Our girls, 10 and 12, had so much fun in the waves. I would suggest going down early to reserve your chairs (by 8:00 or maybe a bit earlier). Just take your towels down and put them on - the signs say you can't, but EVERYONE does! The Sushi bar opens at noon - absolutely DELICIOUS. We had it EVERYDAY!!! You can order two at a time.....get in line at 11:45 because it takes a long time to get your meal as they make it right in front of you. Be first in line!!!!! All afternoon there is fries, hamburgers, tacos, amazing wings, drinks,etc.......to eat. You can always go into the buffet and grab some ice cream or whatever else you want. What we loved the best was that when our girls were hungry an hour after they just ate, they could go and find some more food!!!! The only negative thing about the resort is that the pools are FREEZING....too cold to get in......at least for us. The kids pool is better but it isn't deep - too shallow for our kids. My husband wants to go back to this resort ASAP!!!!! This is a family resort so adults without children may not want to come here - but I sure would - there are kids everywhere but there are so many clubs for them to attend that they are off and away enjoying being with the wonderful leaders. This is a MUST resort - our family LOVED it!

I travelled to Cancun from Jan 30-Feb 6 with my 4 young kids and 10 other adults. We had a great visit. I was most impressed with the ocean clarity and the service staff. I was most disappointed by the rough waters and wind as well as the tummy troubles experienced by my family. (some may be due to kids swallowing pool water but some was definitely from the food. I would recommend rinsing any non peeled fruit with bottle water and staying away from lettuce or other rinsed fruits or veggies in Mexico) . I was also disappointed that we did not know of an activity sheet until our trip was over half over and we missed out on some activities (recommend asking Concierge upon arrival for activity sheet)
reviews.title: Overall quite pleased

reviews.text: pros.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - lots of food options with a lot of made to order food
reviews.title: Great vacation!

reviews.text: - great kid's paradise (a supervised kid's pool and activities area)
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - baby club for 3 and under
reviews.title: If you are looking for quality, this is not the place for you!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Crown Paradise Club from28/10/2007 to 11/11/2007 for my daughters wedding. We had the upgraded rooms with jacuzzi, free mini bar etc. Room was perfect with sea view cleaned at least 2 times a day sometimes 3. Private cocktail bar was good.
reviews.title: My Daughters Wedding

reviews.text: Restaurants excellent - except the Italien which was rubbish, dont have your reception in there, we were forced to as other retaurants were shut. Bars all good.
reviews.title: Great vacation

likes.liked: — child friendly and wonderful on staff doctor

reviews.text: Staff excellent, happy and helpfull. Wedding went with no problems and was excellent, not on the beach as sea was to rough.
reviews.title: Great deal

reviews.text: Sea was rough all the time with little or no beach, still its their winter.
reviews.title: Awesome Family Vacation

reviews.text: Trips out were excellent, we would recommend Cich e nista, the jungle / coral reef tour, and you have to go to the Co Co Bongo night club that is a must do place.
reviews.title: Wonderful Escape

reviews.text: Upon checking to the resort we were told that we had to purchase a seven day inclusive food and drink package even though we stayed only six nights. Later, we were informed that this was an error on the desk persons part. I asked for a refund and the desk manager, Edgar, was only marginally helpful and acted like the money had to come from his own pocket. This was especially annoying because this was their mistake in the first place. This was our sixth visit to this resort and we noticed that they were slipping down in several areas. Like I said the front desk help was inadequate and ill mannered. The Italian restaurants food was a disapointment.With watery bland sauces, this is one eatery to pass on. The Fishermans was good, however, it may be time to change up the menu a little. The buffet was adequate but could use some improvement in some areas. The service in the eateries was good. The room was good except for the hard as concrete mattress and lumpy pillows. By the second night my back was in misery from the mattress. We have a 10y/o daughter who absolutely enjoyed the kids club. The staff there is exceptional and make the most out your vacation by ensuring that your child has a great time. The shows in the theatre are a bonus and provide good entertainment for all. We will return to this resort but with the hopes that some things improve...
reviews.title: some good and some bad things

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Crown Paradise with another couple Feb 5th - Feb12th.
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation, would not stay again.

reviews.text: Check in: Friendly greeting, had to wait about an hour for our room to be ready, they took our luggage, so we got a drink & walked around until our room was ready, no problems.
reviews.title: Average Vacation!

reviews.text: Room: We stayed in the Crown Club room, which meant we had access to the Crown Club Lounge for breakfast, afternoon cocktails & free internet access. The room itself was very nice. It was clean, no bad smells, view of the ocean, fridge packed daily with soda, water, juice & beer. There was a fruit plate & champange waiting for us when we got there.
reviews.title: A lot better resorts out there for the same money

reviews.text: Food: I read a lot of reviews of people absolutely hating the food, to the point where thaty didn't even eat at the resort their whole trip. I am not a picky eater by any means, I know not to expect 5 star cuisine. The food at the main buffet that's open to everyone for breakfast, lunch & dinner was the only food I did NOT like. We ate breakfast everyday in the Crown Club Lounge althought the food was similar, I found it to be more fresh. Lunch we ate everyday at the main pool where they have hamburgers, hotdogs, fries, chicken nuggets, chicken wings, nachos...the line moves quickly, unlike waiting inside the main buffet for a hamburger or hotdog. Fujiyamam the asian restaurant, is open for lunch and is done at 5:00. I loved the food there, that was always a mid afternoon snack. We tried every restaurant except for the Mexican one. My favorite's were the French & Itailian (ate twice at each.) The food at all the resaurants was SO good! We all loved it. We had no problems getting reservations, we called before 9:00am to make them for the following night. Room service was prompt & decent food.
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading all the bad reviews on this resort i was worried, but after staying there from jan 15 to jan 22, i can honestly say that there is nothing wrong with thjs resort.
reviews.title: Anyone who wrote a bad review, was wrong!

reviews.text: the food was absolutely the best, the three best resturants are the italian, the french, and waynes boots, you have to try the mechanical bull, what a hoot.
reviews.title: This resort really suited us.

reviews.text: the beach was one of the best ive been to, but you do have to go early to get a chair, lots of local venders on the beach but none of them were overly aggresive or annoying.
reviews.title: Crown Paridise trip #2

reviews.text: p.s. cigars on beach are fake, only buy from la casa de habenos or duty free at air port.
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation!

reviews.text: the staff, some of the most friendliest people ive met, gwendoline who work in the crown club room was propably the most helpful and nicest, followedby diego the bell boy. best bartenders had to be alfie at the adult pool, and rogelio at the lobby bar.
reviews.title: An amazing family vacation!

reviews.text: We stayed at the Crown Paradise in June 2005. Before going I had read some negative feedback on trip advisor and wish now that I had took more notice. The hotel is not that bad, but is certainly not a five star hotel.
reviews.title: not a five star hotel

reviews.text: The good points; the staff are friendly and the food is good. The entertainment by the pool is good and the rooms were clean.
reviews.title: Absolutely terrible for couples
Had a Great Time
reviews.text: However, the rest of the hotel looks in desperate need of re decorating, it was also not that clean (there were used room service trays with half eaten food on outside rooms for days on end). There was also a smell near the adult pool which came from the sewerage plant across the road.
There was a shortage of sunloungers and not much entertainment on a night for adults.
reviews.title: had a fun time

reviews.text: Cancun itself was lovely, the nightlife was fantastic and would definatley recommend to anyone. However, unless you want to pay five star price for a three star hotel I would not recommend the Crown Paradise, we have previosly stayed at much nicer hotels in mexico for the same or less than this cost - overall we were disappointed.
reviews.title: Best Value in Cancun

reviews.text: Crown Paradise Club 4/24/05-5/1/05
reviews.title: Wonderful family hotel (restaurants A++++++)
Excellent Place
reviews.text: Reservations

reviews.title: FANTASTIC VACATION
reviews.text: I found the best deal for this hotel with a Canadian Travel Agency (restelinc) even though I live in NY and we used frequent flyer miles for the airline. I traveled with my husband (51), and 2 kids (ages 12 and 9).

reviews.title: Got Kids??? You`ll Love It!!!
reviews.text: Airport/Transfers

reviews.title: 50/50- its a gamble
reviews.text: Beforehand, I e-mailed Brant’s service (entertainment-plus) to get airport transfers. The cost for all 4, round-trip was $65.00. Before you exit the terminal to go outside you are bombarded by timeshare sharks (people in white shirts) so just keep walking outside. Behind barriers were about 75 people holding up signs. Immediately, we spotted our name held by Luis, He took our luggage and within minutes he radioed his driver and we were on our way. About 15 minutes we were at the hotel.
Overall I was not impressed with this hotel vacation. I expected quite a bit more for the money we paid.
reviews.title: A little disappointing
An All Inclusive to Avoid
reviews.text: The cons: The restaurant options were not good. For example, the steak place was terrible and the top of the line option smelled of mildew (perhaps this was a hurricane related problem). The bartenders were a bit short with my wife during the day. The gym wasn't good and running along the street asn't much of a thrill.

The pros: The breakfast was very good. They had two mex dinner options that we enjoyed. The all inclusive did include child care options that our kids liked for at least a few days;) The pools and beach were decent. We also liked a few options in Cancun for shopping (Zara) and dinner.
reviews.title: Disappointed - crowded, tired facilites

likes.liked: — I didn't really like anything there

reviews.text: Not anything like we expected. We arrived on Christmas and since we missed making reservations ( as we were flying) we had our Christmas dinner in a cafeteria. The bell boy lead us to a courtyard and pointed at a building where our room was and left us in the dark to, obviously we got lost. We had booked an ocean view room we did not get an ocean view room but were told that if we packed up and left the room by noon the next day at 3 they would let us know if an ocean view room had come available. One of the big sellers to us was the kid play area. It was as it looked but there was virtually no supervision 4 or 5 young adults hung out at the door and there was one in the lifeguard chair. Most upsetting was that we arrived at 2:30 one day and were greated by girls telling the staff that there was poo on the bathroom floor when we left at 4:20 when the area closed there was still poo on the bathroom floor. Not surprising that since two of us in our room spent more time at the toilet than planned with a " digestive issue " caused by something on site. Most important each time we asked the front staff or concierge for a solution to our problem it was answered with a shrug of the shoulders and an oh well.
reviews.title: Awful - Trapped in Paradise

likes.disliked: — they have no concept if Customer Service or Satisfaction

reviews.text: The staff of the cafeteria was excellent though. Several of the men were on duty from 7:30 to 8:30 daily every day we were there and they were always pleasant, helpful and competent, And of course the beach is beautiful . This is such an amazing spot in the world so be sure to research tons so nothing takes away from the experience
reviews.title: Had a WONDERFUL TRIP!!!

likes.liked: — The staff is number one and the beach was awesome!

reviews.text: This was our 3rd time and we enjoyed it again very much. The kids love it and they love the many different places to eat, so if they are happy then we certainly are. There are much posher and newer hotels in Cancun but you will pay much more for it and may not get the same enjoyment as The Crown Paradise. We love this hotel for the choice of resturants and the overall relaxed atmosphere of it. Cancun is good for families and its safe to go out and about there is some fab shopping malls, exciting excursions and you can even go to sea world swim with the dolphins or have a go on the waterslides. Some reviews make this hotel sound awfull but it certainly IS NOT, I am not sure what they were expecting but go and see for yourself and I am sure you will have a good time.
reviews.title: Great time !! go and see for yourself.

reviews.text: We just got home from Crown Paradise, I would say its an average place, the place itself is very beautiful and the beach is awesome. The food's not awesome unless you make reservations for one of the sit down dinners, but that is only once a day and must be done a day in advance. They did have some great waterpark & slides for the kids along with great activities for them. I probably would stay there agian if I was low on cash but if I had to do over I would save up more and stay at a little nicer resort. As far as the rooms we had a water line break and flood are room which was aweful and I came back from snorkeling all day and was wet, tired and hungry and couldn't get into my room for hours! They never even offered any compensation for that which I felt they should have especially after I finally got back in my room to find wet toliet paper & tissues and called to have them replaced and they never did come had to borrow some from family!
reviews.title: Somethings were nice others not so nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also the noise coming from the other rooms next to ours was terrible the walls were paper thin and we could hear snoring, farting and coughing all night and never did get any sleep! Not to mention there beds are on a cemet block with a mattress thrown on it! On the way to the airport several other guests checking out mention that there beds were like rocks also!
reviews.title: AMAZING! Need to go back! So beautiful

reviews.text: I would have to say overall I wasn't blown away but there were things I did like. I would much rather stay somewhere I could sleep and get great food always!
reviews.title: germ factory

reviews.text: After going to Gran Caneria in 2008, i did not think that i could find a better place to go until i came here for 2 weeks! I could not fault this hotel in any way shape or form. The staff are so friendly and will help with anything and their strawberry daiquiris are immense. The lobby/reception is open plan so the breeze from the sea flows through the hotel. They have many amazing restaurants and bars which have different themes so you are guaranteed to like the food.
reviews.title: The kids loved it and we did too, not 5 star but nice and well worth the price

reviews.text: LOBBY: nice until you check in. There are 3 elevators per tower. The whole week we were there they had one elevator that was broken, no one fixed it. The line for the elevator was ridiculous. It was all day. Sometimes we had no other choice but to take the stairs up 3 floors. There is a hospitality room for new arrivals. Your family can wait in there if your room is not ready. There are showers, a tv, books, and travel information in there. They will only give you your room at 3:00. Not earlier. So if you get there before then you will have to wait for it.
reviews.title: You Buy cheap, You get Cheap. Not coming here again...

reviews.text: ROOM: NEVER GOT AN UPGRADE. Before my trip I had found a coupon on tripadvisor.com for a free room upgrade for this hotel at the time of check in. I asked repeatedly at the lobby if he had upgraded us and he evaded my questions every time. The room itself has very old broken down furniture. We had room 1309. The balcony door was missing a handle so when we would go out on the balcony we could not close the door all the way. We did have a view of the ocean but it was not "ocean front view". The majority of our view was an abandoned construction site next door. The a/c does work, the beds are hard (typical of Mexico), however the pillows are not standard size, they are not even bed pillows, they are sofa accent pillows! very hard and uncomfortable. I travel a lot and I have never seen pillows so small. You do need to leave your a/c on to muffle the noise from the lobby. The room was an extreme disappointment. I had been to Cancun before and was expecting somewhat the same, man was I wrong. There was no decorations, no dresser, no fridge, and no luggage rack. We had to leave all of our clothes in our luggages for the week. The TV did not work with the remote and the volume did not work. I was traveling with a large group and checked out all of their rooms. THey all had nicer rooms(not much, but nicer than mine) and their maids would leave them towel decorations formed into the shape of animals or flowers.
reviews.title: Clean resort

reviews.text: BATHROOM: Our maid never cleaned our floor or bathtub the entire week we were there, nor did she leave us any type of towel animals. Our floor and tub was disgusting and full of sand and hair. It is ironic that I got the worst service and room since I was the one that organized the entire trip for everyone. One time she even left us without toilet paper and kleenex!! They do provide you with a coffeemaker, shampoo, conditioner, and soap.
reviews.title: Good vacation, but could be better

reviews.text: POOLS: Infinity pool is nice and is where the action happens, however there is no swim up bar. The adult pool is nice for those who do not have kids. It is on the other side of the hotel and is the only pool with a swim up bar and jacuzzi. The Kids paradise pools are great for kids. The indoor pool is nice and the water is warmer at this pool than all the others. The only jacuzzi in the hotel is located at the adult only pool. **DO NOT LOSE YOUR TOWEL, you will be charged $35 for losing it. **very important** if you want a good spot at the infinity pool you MUST get down and reserve your lounge chairs by 6:15 am. People hold their lounge chairs with their towels or clothes. My suggestion take your own personal character beach towels, people will not steal them.
reviews.title: PLEASE DO NOT GO HERE!!! you will regret it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: RESTAURANTS: YOU MUST MAKE RESERVATIONS THE DAY BEFORE BY 8:15 AM!!! if you want to eat at a restaurant you must have a reservation. The only way to make it is to call Reservations the day before you want to eat. However, you must call by 8:15am. All of the restaurants serve alcohol except The Palapa (buffet). All of them accept children except the French one, Sans Souci.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Pleased

reviews.text: Returned last week following a 2 week stay where my wife and I travelled with another couple (all mid 30's). From check in to check out we had a fantastic holiday and I would definately recommend both Cancun and the CPC to anyone.
reviews.title: Another great holiday
Amazing!!
reviews.text: Whilst respecting other Trip Advisor opinions, we could not fault the hotel in any way. We stayed in one of the Crown Club Rooms (Tower 2) and had, amongst other things, daily restocking of the mini-bar (free of charge), jacuzzi, x-tra large bed, good air conditioning, bath robes/slippers, petals on the bed/jacuzzi following the maids visits each day (room cleaned by 10AM every day), exclusive use of the Crown Club lounge for cocktails, continental breakfast, priority check in & out.. etc..etc...

One thing you wil notice is the cleanliness of the whole hotel. It seems that someone is cleaning 24 hours a day and the help offered by the staff througout was very much appreciated. Nothing seemed too much troule and the waiters and bar staff were forever friendly.
reviews.title: A good family vacation...

reviews.text: We ate at all the resteraunts and were impressed with quality of the food everywhere (even room service) and the portions were just right, allowing room for the numerous deserts. Waynes Boots was our fvourite, followed by the 50's (a-la-carte). We had the free meal in our room, which we shared with our friends and the quality was again excellent. I would advise you book this asap following arrivak as they have limited sittings per week so even if you have paid for the meal as part of your holiday, if they have no space available you will not be able to have the meal. Likewise with the free lunch cruise, make sure you book this within one or two days of arrival as the spaces are filled quickly. With regards to the lunch cruise, prepare to drink a lot!
reviews.title: Great time!!
Enjoyed this Resort!
reviews.text: The pool areas do get busy early and if you wish to stop by one of the two main pools it is adviseable to have towels down by 7am at the latest. Alternatively you can always use the beach (although this is half the size it was following Hurricane Ivan last year) or the Adult Pool where there always seems to be plenty of chairs available.

description: At the Crown Paradise Club experience extraordinary vacations in the best all inclusive hotel in Cancun; with areas designed for children of all ages, theme restaurants, activities and entertainment created for each member of your family, where you will experience moments with them that you will treasure forever.
